snippet: The Swiss are set to vote on a proposal that would give shareholders a binding say on compensation for executives and board members.
abstract: Switzerland is set to vote on whether to adopt proposal by Parliament member Thomas Minder to impose some of world's most severe restrictions on executive compensation; prospect is opposed by banks and other multinational companies that have long dominated country's economy, which say rules will damage business-friendly climate.
lead_paragraph: The Swiss are set to vote on a proposal that would give shareholders a binding say on compensation for executives and board members.

headline.main: Showdown on Executive Compensation in Switzerland
headline.print_headline: Showdown on Executive Pay in Switzerland Goes to a Vote
